conclusion: We have a cylindrical optical element with a cross-section ABC. AC is an arc with radius R, and O is the center of this arc. ABCO forms a square.
There is a point light source at O, and we're considering light rays emitted from O into the arc AC.
The refractive index of the material is given as n = 2.
The condition for total internal reflection is that the angle of incidence is greater than the critical angle θ_c, which is given by sin θ_c = 1/n.
If a ray approaches AB or BC at an angle greater than 30° from the normal, it will undergo total internal reflection and not exit.

ABCO is a square, and O is the center of the arc AC, which has radius R.

premise: Consider a ray emitted from O towards a point on AC, making an angle θ with the line OA.

The length of the arc where these lights are incident is FH = (1/6)πR.
